page.title: 13TOURISM
page.content: Notable features of Leyland include: 1)a Saxon Cross 2)a Norman Parish Church mentioned in the original Domes Day Book ,3)the Eagle and Child Inn (formerly a nunnery and magistrates court/cells) 4)various old halls including a)Peacock Hall-a moated house built in 1626 b)Dunkirk Hall-a 17th century farmhouse which is now a public house.c)Old Hall-a tunnel is reputed to lead to the Parish Church.d)Worden Hall-built in 1742 and the home of the Squire of Leyland from 1742 until destroyed by fire in 1941.Part has been restored and is used by the C.P.R.E.The stables and out building are now a craft centre. 5)The Commercial Vehicle Museum is housed in part of the old Leyland Motors.
